required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prophylaxis Ephedrine or Ondansetron Prevents Hypotension After Spinal Anesthesia for Cesarean Section
clinical_study.official_title: Prophylaxis Ephedrine or Ondansetron Prevents Hypotension After Spinal Anesthesia for Cesarean Section; a Randomized, Double Blinded, Placebo Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
Maternal hypotension after spinal anesthesia in parturients undergoing cesarean section is a very common problem leading to several complications to both patients and their babies. It can cause maternal discomfort, lightheadedness, nausea and vomiting. The most important complication is the decreasing blood flow to babies; which may lead to fetal acidosis.
Many interventions has been studied in order to prevent hypotension after spinal anesthesia in cesarean section e.g., fluid loading: colloid vs crystalloid, medications: ephedrine, phenylephrine, and metaraminol, etc. The recent study showed ondansetron (the antiemetic drug) can be effectively used to prevent hypotension after spinal anesthesia in normal patients or parturients. The action of ondansetron is believed to inhibit Bezold-Jarish reflex.
This aim of this study is to compare the efficacy of ephedrine and ondansetron in the prevention of maternal hypotension after spinal anesthesia in cesarean section.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparing efficacy of ondansetron to ephedrine in the prevention of hypotension.
primary_outcome.time_frame: After spinal block to until baby delivered
primary_outcome.description: Ondansetron or ephedrine will be given immediately after spinal anesthesia, then record blood pressure and heart rate one-minutely until delivery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal symptom: Nausea and vomiting after spinal anesthesia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After spinal anesthesia until baby delivered

other_outcome.time_frame: one minute and five minute after delivery

clinical_study.condition: Anesthesia; Adverse Effect, Spinal and Epidural

arm_group.description: Ephedrine 10 mg in Normal Saline 10 ml
Ondansetron 8 mg in Normal saline 10 ml

intervention.description: Ondasetron 8 mg IV after spinal anesthesia
Ephedrine 10 mg IV after spinal anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age > 18 years
- Elective cesarean section
- Patient accept spinal anesthesia
- ASA classification I-II
- Term, Singleton pregnancy
- Understand all process in this study
Exclusion Criteria:
- DM any type that not the gestational DM
- Hypertensive disorder
- BMI>40
- Complicated pregnancy such as placenta previa, preeclampsia
- Allergic to study drugs
- Long QT syndrome
- Contraindication to spinal anesthesia

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Anesthesiology, Faculty of Medicine Siriraj Hospital
